DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Giving pain medication space wall spinal canal cover spinal cord give vein may help lessen pain caused cancer surgery . It yet know whether epidural analgesia effective patient-controlled analgesia control pain patient undergone surgery gynecologic cancer . PURPOSE : This randomized clinical trial study epidural analgesia see well work compare patient-controlled analgesia treat patient undergone surgery gynecologic cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Epidural Analgesia Patient-Controlled Analgesia Treating Patients Who Have Undergone Surgery Gynecologic Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Determine whether gradual wean epidural opioid shorten duration postoperative ileus , without worsen pain control , patient undergo surgery gynecologic cancer . - Compare postoperative pain management patient treat perioperative epidural analgesia v patient control analgesia . - Compare time ambulation , return bowel function , readiness hospital discharge patient treat pain management intervention . - Compare incidence perioperative complication ( e.g. , bleeding , hypotension , thromboembolic event , pneumonia , wound infection , myocardial infection , death ) patient treat pain management intervention . OUTLINE : This partially randomize , double-blind , parallel-group study . Patients choose epidural analgesia patient control analgesia ( PCA ) perioperative pain management . Patients epidural contraindicate receive PCA . Patients assign 1 2 treatment group . Patients group 1 stratify accord bowel resection surgery ( yes v ) prior abdominal surgery ( yes v ) . - Group 1 ( epidural ) : Patients undergo placement thoracic epidural catheter follow abdominal/pelvic surgery . Patients begin epidural infusion ropivacaine hydrochloride fentanyl immediately surgery ( postoperative day 0 ) . Patients may also supplement patient control demand dose . The day surgery ( postoperative day 1 ) , patient randomize ( long adequate pain control ) 1 2 epidural management arm . - Arm I : Patients continue receive epidural infusion wean oral pain medication . - Arm II : Patients undergo daily wean fentanyl concentration epidural infusion . - Group 2 ( PCA ) : Patients begin PCA immediately undergo abdominal/pelvic surgery ( postoperative day 0 ) . Patients receive demand schedule hydromorphone IV wean oral pain medication . In group , Gynecologic Oncology pain service may make adjustment epidural infusion PCA optimal pain management patient wean oral pain medication . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 224 patient accrue study .
